Articles.Content:
I used 2008 parts, weighs 26,851.9 tons wet.

Single launch...

Holds 4,457 Kerbals.

I modified parts, but kept the mass, cost, fuel volume, etc. consistent. The exception is the power storage. I made "super capacitors", which doesn't much matter since I am using 30 PB-NUK's and solar panels.

This was done with no cheats. I made it without modifying gravity, drag, and didn't use infinite fuel like I ended up doing with my first monster. Just legitimately modified parts, except battery capacity.

I stretched some parts to size 3. I added fuel comparable to the volume of the size 3 1:4 adapters and 6 point radial adapters on the bottom tier only. I tried to stay real in that the other multipoint connectors allow free movement of Kerbals. Still enough volume to add battery capacity and reaction wheels inside however, so I did.

I barley made orbit, I was shooting for a 250k circular orbit, but I am short of that. At one point, I didn't think I would make orbit. When I tested just the center core before I built around it, and added a little more. I had almost 2 g's. I started very slow on the actual build...

Can anyone else get such a large mass up, and hold more than 4,000 Kerbals? Also have some multi purpose functionality? I also have several Ore processors and several docking ports.

This thing has 288 MK3 Passenger Modules and 24 Mobile processing labs!

Now, all I need to do is refuel it, and move it around another system!

Let us borrow your computer (or allow us to clone it) and THEN maybe the challenge is worth it.........

Seriously, this isn't a challenge, it's a freaking boast in the face for those who can't handle more than a 1k part count.

Maybe give this challenge to whackjob or something......

Also http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24898-Challenge-Submission-Guide

Let us borrow your computer (or allow us to clone it) and THEN maybe the challenge is worth it.........

Seriously, this isn't a challenge, it's a freaking boast in the face for those who can't handle more than a 1k part count.

Maybe give this challenge to whackjob or something......

Also http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24898-Challenge-Submission-Guide

Well, I guess this doesn't quite comply with the intent of the rules. Sorry about that. Still, I found it challenging to build the thing in the limited space of the VAB. Then I had to load it from the Hanger, and use the runway for launching.

If it isn't your thing, then fine. I think someone will see what I did, and try to improve upon it.

I have a pretty fast PC but in 1.0.x performance is terrible.

I made this orbital city a few months back, didn't bother to try and build a launcher for it, it would probably be the size of the KSC itself.

"Only" 1100 parts and as a result I had seconds per frame instead of fps.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129466-77-Industries-Orbital-City-Achernar

So it's a nice challenge, but with 99.5% of the computers too weak to support 2008 parts, I guess the first contenders will be after 1.1 is released.

That's stunning. What tools does it take for such a task? I used the KSC to build mine.

Meh.

When you turn out a fully functional fuel depot with docked tanks, 18k/23k fuel/ox and 5k RCS, with 4 craft useable docking ports (plus station tug port), station tug, 6 gigantors, and keep it aesthetically pleasing and modular, while maximizing functionally, at less than 100 parts, then you'll have a challenge.

Must include lighting for all ports, responsive handling, probe core, and dedicated crew transfer facility. Must also be able to change orbit effectively using the tug at full thrust (stability issue, not TWR).

Meh.

When you turn out a fully functional fuel depot with docked tanks, 18k/23k fuel/ox and 5k RCS, with 4 craft useable docking ports (plus station tug port), station tug, 6 gigantors, and keep it aesthetically pleasing and modular, while maximizing functionally, at less than 100 parts, then you'll have a challenge.

Must include lighting for all ports, responsive handling, probe core, and dedicated crew transfer facility. Must also be able to change orbit effectively using the tug at full thrust (stability issue, not TWR).

Was this one of the challenges?

I don't know about keeping it under 100 parts... Was this with, or with launcher?
This is not only a beautiful station (that kinda belongs in the exchange), but it could also be a great genocide machine, depending on how well the launch goes.

I'm pretty happy with my selection of a new laptop. I bought the MSI GP70 Leopard Pro. Cost me $1,050, now they are going for over $1,100.

http://www.cpubenchmark.net/high_end_cpus.html

Only 35.6% as fast as the fastest on this chart, but it's not a $4,700 CPU either.

Edited September 21, 2015 by Wild Cobra

Here's a large station I built but lagging was major, I can't imagine going near 2k.

Engineer's Report

Mass:4,343.1t
Size
Height:80.7m
